newsitem.title: DENMARK: Indefatigable Danish shares resume upward path.
newsitem.headline: Indefatigable Danish shares resume upward path.

text.p: Danish share prices closed the week with an earlier-than-forecast rally after two days of profit taking and dealers saw a revived bond market helping boost shares further next week.
"There has been good healthy interest in many shares, spread fairly well out," a dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index gained 0.46 point to 128.64 -- close to its current record 128.82 -- in overall bourse turnover of xxx million crowns.
The KFX December future fell 0.30 point to 129.10 with 50 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.

Dealers said there was plenty of liquidity chasing good buys. Among fancied paper on Friday was Carlsberg, which rose six crowns to 383 crowns after a 'buy' recommendation from Aros Securities in turnover of 195,000 shares traded.
SAS, which on Thursday said it would raise some prices to compensate for rising fuel costs, climbed 3.5 crowns to 75 crowns, in turnover of 425,000.
